intro: Coccoloba nutans, commonly known as the spreading glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble a hand. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Coccoloba nutans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats.
